item.title: Application software
item.description: Applications Â§ An application, or app, sometimes called application software, consists of programs designed to make users more productive, conduct business, or provide entertainment.

item.title: Boolean, logic gates, and bitwise operations
item.description: See also: Data representation Logic operations Â§ OperationInputSymbolOutputBufferAANOTAAË‰ANDA,BABORA,BA+BNANDA,BABË‰XORA,BAË‰B+ABË‰ Logic operations based on Boolean algebra may be used on Boolean data to produce a result of either true (1) or false (0).

item.title: Character representation
item.description: Character representation Â§ Character data cannot be represented directly in a computer because computers process only bits; such data is represented indirectly by defining a table that assigns a numeric value to each character.

item.title: Data representation
item.description: Computer systems represent data electrically and process it with electrical switches with 2 states (on / off) that express binary data. Computers deal with all sorts of non-numeric data (e.

item.title: Integer representation

item.title: Internetworking
item.description: Computer networks Â§ A computer network refers to the connection of two or more computers through software and hardware, facilitating communication between them.

item.title: Introduction to number systems
item.description: Computers process data into information and work exclusively with numbers. All data is represented in binary form, which represents data in combinations of 1â€™s and 0â€™s.

item.title: Memory components
item.description: Internal memory Â§ Also known as primary memory; refers to memory that stores small amounts of data that can be accessed quickly while the computer is running.
